helen.shapes

Class RegularPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • helen.shapes.Shape
      • helen.shapes.RegularPolygon

  • public class RegularPolygon
extends Shape
    models a regular polygon (polygon with congruent angles and sides)
    Version:
    10.11.17
    Author:
    Helen Wang

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class helen.shapes.Shape

        x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RegularPolygon()
      constructs default polygon: a triangle starting at 250, 250 and sideLengths = to 100
      RegularPolygon(int sides, double length)
      Constructs a regular polygon with the specified starting point, sides, and sidelengths, and starting point at (250,250)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegularPolygon

        public RegularPolygon()
        constructs default polygon: a triangle starting at 250, 250 and sideLengths = to 100

      • RegularPolygon

        public RegularPolygon(int sides,
                      double length)
        Constructs a regular polygon with the specified starting point, sides, and sidelengths, and starting point at (250,250)
        Parameters:
        sides - number of sides on the shape, must be non-negative
        length - how long each side is
        Postcondition:
        array sides is initialised, outCircle and inCircle are created as the circumscribed/inscribed circles

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        draws the polygon
        Overrides:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet object
        Precondition:
        affected by PApplet pre-set conditions

      • drawBoundingCircles

        public void drawBoundingCircles(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        draws the circumscribed and inscribed circle
        Parameters:
        drawer - PApplet object
        Precondition:
        affected by preset PApplet object
        Postcondition:
        draws the circumscribed circle around the polygon, filled in blue, and the inscribed circle, filled in red and sets their colours

      • calcSides

        public void calcSides()
        calculates the sides of the polygon using the angle and starting points creates new Line representing each side, and adds it to the sides array
        Postcondition:
        sides array has new Lines added to it

      • findAngle

        public double findAngle()
        finds an angle in radians
        Returns:
        2*pi divided by the number of sides

      • calcVertexAngle

        public double calcVertexAngle()
        calculates the interior angle of the polygon and returns it
        Returns:
        returns the interior angle in radians
